title: How do you monitor and manage resources in a hybrid cloud deployment?

content:
Hybrid cloud deployment integrates public and private cloud resources, focusing on optimizing utilization, enhancing flexibility, and enabling disaster recovery. It ensures high availability and security in scenarios such as enterprise IT and healthcare.

The core components include unified monitoring tools (e.g., Prometheus, Grafana), automation management platforms (e.g., Kubernetes), and security policies, enabling centralized visibility and elastic scaling. In practical applications, it provides resource reports and automatically adjusts instances, improving efficiency and reducing downtime.

Implementation steps: Integrate monitoring solutions (e.g., deploying Grafana), automate resource scheduling (e.g., adjusting instances based on load), and set up alerting policies. Typical scenarios include cost optimization; business values include reducing operational expenses, enhancing compliance, and improving resilience.
